reference: Ashenfelter, Orley and Heckman, James. "Measuring the Effect of an Anti discrimination Program" in Orley Ashenfelter and James Blum, eds., Evaluating the Labor Market Effects of Social Programs (Princeton: Industrial Relations Section, Princeton University, 1976), pp. 46-84. Burman, George. The Economics of Discrimination: The Impact of Public Policy, unpublished Ph.D. thesis, Graduate School of Business, University of Chicago, 1973.

Goldstein, Morris and Smith, Robert S. "The Estimated Impact of the Anti discrimination Program Aimed at Federal Contractors," Industrial and Labor Relations Review, vol. 29, no. 4, July 1976, pp. 523-543.
Heckman, James J. and Wolpin, Kenneth I. "Does the Contract Compliance Program Work? An Analysis of Chicago Data," Industrial and Labor Relations Review, vol. 29, no. 4, July 1976, pp. 544-564.
Leonard, Jonathan. "The Impact of Affirmative Action," U.S. Department of Labor report, July 1983.
Price, Richard and Edwin Mills, "Race and Residence in Earnings Determina tion," unpublished paper, 1983.
Straszheim, Mahlon, "Discrimination and the Spatial Characteristics of the Urban Labor Market for Black Workers," Journal of Urban Economics, vol. 7, Nol 1, January 1980, pp. 119-140.
Smith, James and Welch, Finis, "Affirmative Action and Labor Markets," unpublished paper, UCLA, 1983.
Welch, Finis, "Affirmative Action and its Enforcement," American Economic Review, vol. 71, No. 2, May 1981, pp. 127-133.
